meanings.sent1: The noncolored sky was a dull gray.
meanings.sent2: She preferred noncolored clothes over bright ones.
meanings.sent3: The noncolored flowers in the garden looked like they were painted in black and white.
meanings.sent4: His noncolored world seemed devoid of joy or excitement.
meanings.sent5: The noncolored walls of the room made it feel cold and unwelcoming.

meanings.sent1: The noncolored pencil left only faint marks on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The noncolored cat blended in with the shadows.
meanings.sent3: She tried to add some color to the noncolored painting, but it just looked odd.
meanings.sent4: His noncolored expression gave nothing away.
meanings.sent5: The noncolored rock stood out among the vibrant gems.
